page.title: 17Twyford Local History
page.content:
Twyford is recorded in the Domesday Book.Twyford Church has 2 interesting Norman features i.e. a doorway and the chancel arch.The last family,the Wenmans,to hold the Manor of Twyford in the mid 1800's have a memorial in the church.
The oldest house in the village is St.Mary's House situated at the rear of the church.It dates from the 15th century and was originally an open hall house-the roof timbers are still coated with tar from the open fires. It has seen much alteration but still retains much of its original wooden structure.There are a few 17th century houses plus a pub.The present Village Hall was built in 1930.The Congregational Chapel was built on the site of the village pound in 1897 at a cost of 400,next to the old chapel.
